Path.description: Specifies a path to one or more locations.

Recurse.description: Gets the items in the specified locations and in all child items of the locations.

Filter.description: Specifies a filter in the provider's format or language.

Include.description: Specifies items that this cmdlet gets.

Exclude.description: Specifies items that this cmdlet omits.

Force.description: Allows the cmdlet to get items that can't otherwise be accessed, such as hidden or system files.

Get-ChildItem.description: Gets the items and child items in one or more specified locations.

Name.description: Specifies one or more processes by process name.

Id.description: Specifies one or more processes by process ID (PID).

Get-Process.description: Gets the processes that are running on the local computer.

Name.description: Specifies the names of one or more processes to stop.

Id.description: Specifies the process IDs of one or more processes to stop.

Force.description: Forces the cmdlet to stop the specified processes without prompting for confirmation.

PassThru.description: Returns an object representing the item with which you are working.

Stop-Process.description: Stops one or more running processes.

AutoSize.description: Adjusts the column size and number of columns based on the width of the data.

Wrap.description: Displays text that exceeds the column width on the next line.

Format-Table.description: Formats the output as a table.

Property.description: Specifies the properties to display in a list.

Format-List.description: Formats the output as a list of properties for each object.

Path.description: Specifies the path to the CSV file to import.

Delimiter.description: Specifies the delimiter that separates the property values.

Header.description: Specifies an alternate column header row for the imported file.

Import-Csv.description: Creates table-like custom objects from the items in a CSV file.

First.description: Selects the specified number of objects from the beginning of an array.

Last.description: Selects the specified number of objects from the end of an array.

Unique.description: Selects unique objects from an array.

Select-Object.description: Selects specified properties of an object or set of objects.

Value.description: Specifies the value for which the property is tested.

Where-Object.description: Selects objects from a collection based on their property values.
